newsitem.title: CHINA: China closes bids for Three Gorges turbines.
newsitem.headline: China closes bids for Three Gorges turbines.

text.p: China closed international bidding on Wednesday for the supply of generators for its huge Three Gorges hydroelectric dam, an official of the China Yangtze Three Gorges Development Corp said on Wednesday.
He refused to say how many companies had submitted bids or to identify the firms and consortia involved.
"The only think I can tell you is the that the bidding procedure went without a hitch," he said by telephone.
China plans to buy 14 turbine generators, each of 700 megawatts, for the plant.
Officials have said that two consortia made up of firms from Canada and Europe were frontrunners. A third bidder is believed to be from Japan.
China hopes 12 of the 14 left-bank generators will be mainly foreign-made and the other two domestically sourced.

Bidders for the 14 left-bank generators will have to declare their arrangements for joint production to ensure an opportunity for domestic producers to gain expertise to build the 12 right-bank generators, officials have said.
The first generators would start production in 2003 and the Three Gorges dam that will block the mighty Yangtze will generate 85 million megawatt hours a year when it is completed in 2009.
